intro: Ouratea stenobasis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or red when mature. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
